summary: This is a transcript from the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell on November 30, 2021. It includes the direct and cross-examination of a pilot (Larry Visoski) who worked for Jeffrey Epstein, detailing Epstein's properties, aircraft, and staff. It also includes the direct examination of a victim (testifying under the pseudonym 'Jane') who described meeting Epstein and Maxwell at age 14 and subsequent sexual abuse involving both of them. This document appears to be an index or table of contents from a court transcript, listing sections of testimony (direct, cross, redirect examination) and exhibits (government, defendant, joint) with corresponding page numbers. It indicates legal proceedings involving multiple attorneys and exhibits.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: On trial for charges related to the sexual abuse of minors. Described by the pilot as Epstein's "number 2" who handled finances and property management. The victim testified that Maxwell was frequently present during sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case. The pilot described his employment by Epstein, his properties, and aircraft. The victim described meeting him at age 14 and subsequent sexual abuse.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Chief pilot for Jeffrey Epstein from 1991 to 2019. Testified about Epstein's aircraft, properties, flight operations, and his observations of Maxwell's role.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge over the trial.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Prosecutor conducting the direct examination of witnesses Larry Visoski and 'Jane'.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Defense counsel conducting the cross-examination of pilot Larry Visoski.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Defense counsel raising procedural issues and objecting during the victim's testimony.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Defense counsel conducting the cross-examination of the victim 'Jane'.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense counsel discussing juror issues with the judge.

persons.name: David Rogers
persons.context: Co-pilot who worked with Larry Visoski for Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: Mentioned by the pilot as the person in New York to whom passenger manifests were sent.

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.context: Referred to as 'Kellen' in the transcript. Described by the pilot as an employee who scheduled flights in the 2000s.

persons.name: Nadia Marcinkova
persons.context: Referred to as 'Marcinko' in the transcript. Described by the pilot as a personal assistant to Epstein.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Billionaire owner of The Limited. The pilot testified that Epstein visited him in Columbus, Ohio, and received a car from him.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned by the pilot and the victim as having flown on Epstein's plane and being part of his social circle.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned by the pilot as having flown on Epstein's plane and by the victim as part of Epstein's social circle.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned by the pilot as having flown on Epstein's plane.

persons.name: Itzhak Perlman
persons.context: Mentioned by the pilot as having flown on Epstein's plane to Interlochen.

persons.name: Ted Waitt
persons.context: Mentioned by the pilot as being in a relationship with Ghislaine Maxwell around 2004.

persons.name: Eva Andersson
persons.context: Referred to as 'Eva' and 'Eva Dubin' in the transcript. Described by the pilot as Epstein's "original first girlfriend."

persons.name: Emmy Tayler
persons.context: Mentioned by the defense as one of Ghislaine Maxwell's assistants who flew on Epstein's planes.

persons.name: Sunny Drescher
persons.context: Paralegal assisting with exhibits during the trial.

persons.name: Ann Lundberg
persons.context: Paralegal for the defense.

persons.name: Ms. Comey
persons.context: Conducted direct examination (page 138) and redirect examination (page 281) during the proceedings.

persons.name: Mr. Everdell
persons.context: Conducted cross-examination (page 182) during the proceedings.

persons.name: Ms. Moe
persons.context: Conducted direct examination (page 286) during the proceedings.

persons.name: Ms. Menninger
persons.context: Conducted cross-examination (page 363) during the proceedings.

connections.description: Pilot Larry Visoski testified Maxwell was Epstein's "number 2," handling finances, property management, and acting as a personal assistant. He also believed they had a personal relationship in the mid-1990s that later fizzled.
Visoski was Epstein's chief pilot from 1991 to 2019. Epstein gave him gifts including land, payment for his daughters' tuition, and cars.
Kellen is described as an assistant who worked for Epstein and sometimes for Maxwell, scheduling flights in the 2000s.
Marcinkova is described as a personal assistant to Epstein, and the pilot considered her also an assistant to Maxwell.
Epstein visited Wexner in Columbus, Ohio. Wexner was described as a client and friend, and gave Epstein a car.
The pilot testified that by 2004, Maxwell was spending a lot of time with Ted Waitt and was involved in decorating his boat.
The pilot testified that former President Clinton flew on Epstein's plane several times in the 2000s.
The pilot testified that Prince Andrew flew on Epstein's plane.
The victim testified that Maxwell was frequently present during sexual abuse by Epstein, instructed her on how to massage Epstein, and participated in sexual acts.
The victim testified that Epstein sexually abused her starting at age 14, including incidents with Maxwell present and in group settings.

events.title: Victim meets Epstein and Maxwell
events.description: The victim, using the pseudonym 'Jane,' met Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell at the Interlochen Arts Camp in Michigan when she was 14 years old. They approached her, talked about camp, and asked for her mother's phone number.

events.title: First sexual abuse of victim
events.description: Shortly after meeting, the victim was invited to Epstein's Palm Beach house for tea with her mother. Later, Epstein began sexually abusing her during visits to his house, with Maxwell frequently present.

events.title: Victim's travel with Epstein and Maxwell
events.description: The victim traveled with Epstein and Maxwell on Epstein's private planes to New York and New Mexico from age 14 until March 2001. Sexual abuse continued during these trips.

events.title: Victim cuts contact with Epstein
events.description: The victim stopped contact with Jeffrey Epstein at the end of 2002 after becoming engaged and her fianc√© questioned the nature of Epstein's calls.

events.title: Victim files lawsuit and receives compensation
events.description: The victim filed a lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell and the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein in early 2020. She later participated in the Epstein victim compensation fund, receiving a $5 million award (netting approximately $2.9 million), and dismissed her lawsuit.

events.title: Juror excused for travel plans
events.description: During the trial, the judge excused Juror #58 who had non-changeable travel plans over the Christmas holiday, creating a potential 10-day break which the judge deemed impractical.

locations: Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's residence at 358 El Brillo Way)
New York, New York (Epstein's townhouse at 9 East 71st Street; Maxwell's residences on East 84th Street and East 65th Street)
Zorro Ranch, Stanley, New Mexico (Epstein's approximately 10,000-acre ranch)
Little St. James Island, U.S. Virgin Islands (Epstein's private island)
keyFacts: Pilot Larry Visoski testified that Ghislaine Maxwell was the "number 2" in Epstein's hierarchy, handling finances and property management, and that he believed she and Epstein had a personal relationship in the mid-1990s.

The victim 'Jane' testified in detail that she was sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein starting at age 14, and that Ghislaine Maxwell was frequently present, participated, and instructed her on how to please Epstein.

The victim received a $5 million award from the Jeffrey Epstein victim compensation fund in 2020, netting approximately $2.9 million after fees, and dismissed her civil lawsuit against Maxwell as part of the settlement.

The pilot testified he never saw any sexual activity or underage girls on Epstein's flights, and that Epstein encouraged pilots to use the restrooms in the passenger cabin, suggesting no effort to hide activity.

The defense, in cross-examination, sought to establish that Maxwell had her own separate residences from Epstein and that her role diminished in the early 2000s as she moved on to a relationship with Ted Waitt.
The document is a structured index for a court transcript, indicating organized legal proceedings.
Multiple attorneys (Ms. Comey, Mr. Everdell, Ms. Moe, Ms. Menninger) were involved in examining witnesses.
Numerous exhibits were entered into evidence, including government exhibits (e.g., 327, 310, 334, 335) and defendant exhibits (e.g., LV3A, LV3B, LV4, LV5).
The transcript was produced by SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C., suggesting it is from a federal court in the Southern District.
The document references page numbers up to at least 406, indicating a lengthy transcript.
